revised_title: The Efficacy of Antimony Compounds in Treating Trypanosomiasis in Rats
tldr: This study investigates the effectiveness of various antimony compounds in treating trypanosomiasis in rats. The researchers found that certain compounds, such as sodium antimonyl malate and ethylantimonyl tartrate, were effective in eliminating trypanosomes from the rats' blood, but some compounds caused significant local irritation and toxicity.
